    • selectColumn

      public void selectColumn(int column) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      This function is in charge of assigning a value to the selectedColumn attribute and allocating a selection buffer of the appropriate size (maximum size is constrained to 3)
      Parameters:
      column - desired column
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - when the selected column exceeds the library's width

    • getSelectedColumn

      public int getSelectedColumn()
      getter function of the selectedColumn attribute
      Returns:
      selectedColumn attribute value

    • getSelectionBufferSize

      public int getSelectionBufferSize()
      This function simply returns the number of available slots in the current selectionBuffer
      Returns:
      space remaining in current selection buffer

    • pushTileToSelectionBuffer

      public int pushTileToSelectionBuffer(TileType tile) throws SelectionBufferFullException
      Function in charge of pushing a new tile in the current selection buffer
      Parameters:
      tile - tile to be pushed in the selection buffer
      Returns:
      number of available slots in the selection buffer (after having pushed)
      Throws:
      SelectionBufferFullException - when a push is attempted and the buffer has already been filled

    • getSelectionBufferCopy

      public TileType[] getSelectionBufferCopy()
      Function in charge of returning a deep-copy of the current selection buffer
      Returns:
      a deep-copy of the current selection buffer

    • reorderSelectionBuffer

      public void reorderSelectionBuffer(int firstIndex, int secondIndex, int thirdIndex) throws AlreadyUsedIndex, InvalidReorderingIndices, IndexOutOfBoundsException, EmptySelectionBuffer
      Function in charge of reordering the current selection buffer
      Parameters:
      firstIndex - index (inside the current selection buffer) of the NEW first tile
      secondIndex - index (inside the current selection buffer) of the NEW second tile
      thirdIndex - index (inside the current selection buffer) of the NEW third tile
      Throws:
      AlreadyUsedIndex - when the same index is provided more than once
      InvalidReorderingIndices - when the index of an unused cell (no tile pushed into it) is provided for reordering
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - when an invalid index is provided
      EmptySelectionBuffer - when trying to reorder an empty selection buffer

    • flushBufferIntoLibrary

      public void flushBufferIntoLibrary() throws NullPointerException
      Function in charge of moving the tiles of the current selection buffer into the selected column. After having done so, current selection buffer is automatically flushed (set to null) NOTE: the tiles are moved to the column with a "gravity" logic starting from index=0. That is to say, going from index = 0 to index = this.bufferTop-1 the buffered tiles are pushed from the bottom, going up
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if a flushed / null buffer is pushed
